headline: If Cheney and Murkowski run against Trump they won't win but will hurt him by tying him to Putin
sentences:
We also have William Barr in is forgiveness? book promoting interviews saying things like this:
Former Attorney General William Barr on Friday said that he did not think the Republican Party could win the White House in 2024 with former President Trump, adding that his ex-boss is "not my idea of a president."

Now with Putin showing himself to be a modern day Hitler it is not too early for the Democrats and anti-Trump Republicans and former Republicans, including of course those in The Lincoln Project, to start a campaign to remind the public of stories like this which include numerous photoshopped images.

Of course there's another alliteration with another word starting with the letter P which could be aptly applied following Putin:
 Poll
 114 votes Show Results
 Assuming he remains healthy, how likely do you think it is that Trump will be the GOP candidate for president in 2023?

Trump being Trump we can hope and expect he will continue to shoot himself in the foot the way he did with this statement:
x
So far polls show that Trump will easily win the Republican primary and they show a tie between him and President Biden in the general election.

However well-known Republican never-Trumpers such as Rep. Liz Cheney, Sen. Lisa Murkowski, and Rep. Adam Kinzinger, as well as Republican moderates who have been less outspoken about Trump like Sen. Mitt Romney, might very well run against him.

Yes, I think the coming presidential election would be a good opportunity for the Republican Party because from my standpoint, the progressive left has  is sort of showing a sort of a totalitarian temperament,? Barr replied.

Yesterday I wrote the following:
Trump himself is mired in his own delusional malignant narcissism where he has continued to show incredibly poor judgment by praising Putin and refusing to condemn him in no uncertain terms.

The more Americans who see Putin for the cold-blooded Hitlerian villain that he is the more likely it is that some may open their minds to admitting to themselves that Trump laid the groundwork for the invasion.

Barr was asked during an interview with CNN's Jake Tapper if he would get involved in a primary challenge against former President Trump and support another candidate if Trump ran, to which he replied, "Yes."

By getting their message out that Trump was a Putin apologist or worse, a traitor, they might well peel off a significant number of voters who'd otherwise vote for Trump and hand the election to Biden.

Trump accepting the soccer ball gift from Putin
Putin's puppet or Putin's poodle, thanks to the luck of having these two catchy alliterations, the titles for these ads are ready made.
See: Trump praises Putin for his move into Ukraine, calling it 'genius (YaHoo News)' and Trump defends praise of Putin even as he calls Ukrainian President 'brave' (CNN Feb. 27).

From The Hill
President Biden is dogged by low approval ratings but how he handles the Russian invasion of Ukraine hopefully will change his poll number for the better.
I don't know whether Trump's arrogance and need to hog the spotlight would result in his debating anyone running against him in the primary.
Those of the GOP president wannabes like Ron DeSantis, Rick Scott, and Greg Abbott who are Trump sycophants won't run if he does.
The video clips of him cozying up to Putin would be used as reminders along with newspaper front pages and photos like these.
Assuming he remains healthy, how likely do you think it is that Trump will be the GOP candidate for president in 2023?

Even if there are no GOP primary debates the fodder for ad campaigns linking Tump to Putin is there.
I think the Republicans can win a decisive majority, but I don't think we can do it with Trump.
I hope he does debate because his fawning support of Putin will no doubt be used against him.

11, 2022 diary)
Trump is all but declaring his intention to run for president.
